alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 6:28PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN BEAUREGARD AND SOUTHWESTERN VERNON PARISHES...NORTHERN NEWTON AND EAST CENTRAL JASPER COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM CST... At 628 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jamestown, or near Newton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... De Ridder, Jasper, Newton, Rosepine, Merryville, Bon Weir, Burkeville, Farrsville, Burr Ferry, Jamestown, Roganville, Junction, Stringtown, Wiergate, and Evans. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
